DataElement.preferredName: Patient Chronic Hepatitis B Infection Undetectable Viral Load Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Yes No Not Applicable Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Usually used to describe a condition that is persistent and long standing._A viral infection caused by the hepatitis B virus._The inability to be noticed, identified or discovered._The number of viral particles (usually HIV) in a sample of blood plasma._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria._The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/not applicable.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Chronic Hepatitis B Infection Undetectable Viral Load Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Usually used to describe a condition that is persistent and long standing._A viral infection caused by the hepatitis B virus._The inability to be noticed, identified or discovered._The number of viral particles (usually HIV) in a sample of blood plasma._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Chronic Hepatitis B Infection Undetectable Viral Load Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Usually used to describe a condition that is persistent and long standing.:A viral infection caused by the hepatitis B virus.:The inability to be noticed, identified or discovered.:The number of viral particles (usually HIV) in a sample of blood plasma.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Usually used to describe a condition that is persistent and long standing.
A viral infection caused by the hepatitis B virus.
The inability to be noticed, identified or discovered.
The number of viral particles (usually HIV) in a sample of blood plasma.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

Concepts.longName: Yes, No, or Not Applicable Response
Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 04-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 8/3/2015 Corrections made to VD in order to restore to original format: removed C49486 as rep term and replaced with C49797; restored long name and definition per Dianne Reeves/tt.

ReferenceDocuments.name: If patient has evidence of ch
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has evidence of chronic hepatitis B (HBV) infection, was there undetectable HBV viral load on suppressive therapy, if indicated?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the HBV viral load undetectable on suppressive therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: For patient with evidence of chronic hepatitis B virus (HBV) infection, is the patient's HBV viral load undetectable on suppressive therapy, if indicated?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: For patients with a history of hepatitis B virus (HBV), is HBV viral load undetectable on suppressive therapy?
